intro: Hackelia longituba, commonly known as the long-stemmed honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hackelia longituba is often found in open woodlands and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils.
